title:
Simply interpolating and Carleson sequences for Hardy spaces in the
  polydisc
abstract:
We study the relation between simply and universally interpolating sequences
for the holomorphic Hardy spaces $H^p(\mathbb{D}^d)$ on the polydisc. In
dimension $d=1$ a sequence is simply interpolating if and only if it is
universally interpolating, due to a classical theorem of Shapiro and Shields.
In dimension $d\ge2$, Amar showed that Shapiro and Shields' theorem holds for
$H^p(\mathbb{D}^d)$ when $p \geq 4$. In contrast, we show that if $1\leq p \leq
2$ there exist simply interpolating sequences which are not universally
interpolating.
